DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy in preterm infants following treatment with BSSL when administered in infant formula.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Bile Salt Stimulated Lipase (BSSL) as Replacement Therapy in Infant Formula for Preterm Infants
DOC.detailed_description: In this double-blind crossover study, patients will be randomized to receive infant formula including BSSL or infant formula without BSSL for the first 7 days. After a wash-out period of 2 days the patients will "crossover" to the other treatment regimen and receive an additional 7 days treatment. The primary efficacy measurements will be made by collecting stool during the last three days of each treatment period.
DOC.criteria: Preterm infants less than or equal to 32 weeks of gestational age appropriate for gestational age enterally fed with infant formula
DOC.keyword: BSSL is present in fresh mother's milk but not in infant formula.
